creator: john@nixnuts.net
text:
Hi there,

I've seen lots of reports of "Content Spoofing" or "Parameter Tampering" vulnerabilities in websites that essentially come down to the website sending the default Apache 404 responses that include the path of the missing URI in the response body.

Examples:

https://hackerone.com/reports/106350

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=850546


Since this is an Apache default it would help to know whether or not the Apache team considers the behavior to be a vulnerability.

Your bugzilla instance has the same behavior.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: The httpd project doesn't consider the request URL in the default error documents as a vulnerability. No default change is planned.
